summary: This document is a chain of emails from October 2020 between an Assistant United States Attorney and FBI Special Agents coordinating the logistics for Ghislaine Maxwell to review sensitive discovery materials at the Metropolitan Detention Center (MDC). It details scheduling changes, security protocols, and instructions for the agents regarding their interaction with Maxwell.

persons.name: Ghislaine Maxwell
persons.context: The accused individual for whom the discovery review is being arranged. She is represented by counsel and is to review materials on a secure laptop at the MDC.

connections.description: Agent M is responsible for bringing the secure laptop for Maxwell's discovery review, indicating a law enforcement custodial role.

events.title: Maxwell Discovery Review at MDC
events.description: A scheduled meeting for Ghislaine Maxwell to review sensitive discovery materials from 8am to 3pm at the Metropolitan Detention Center, facilitated by FBI agents with her attorney present.

events.title: Cancelled Discovery Meeting
events.description: A previously scheduled discovery review meeting for Maxwell was cancelled by her attorney, necessitating rescheduling.

locations: 1 St. Andrew's Plaza, New York, NY 10007
keyFacts: Ghislaine Maxwell was reviewing sensitive discovery materials in custody at the Metropolitan Detention Center in October 2020.
FBI agents were instructed not to engage in any conversation with Maxwell due to her being represented by counsel.
The coordination involved a secure laptop being brought to the MDC for Maxwell's exclusive review of the materials.
The emails show logistical planning between the U.S. Attorney's Office and the FBI regarding a defendant's access to discovery.
